name: Applying perimeter formulas for rectangles in the real world

skills.name: Area and perimeter of rectangles in the real world

explanations.A: To find the perimeter we add the lengths of the all the sides together... 68 + 105 + 68 + 105 = 346 m therefore only Tom is correct.
explanations.B: Katie has calculated the area of the pitch instead of the perimeter. To find the perimeter add the lengths of the all the sides together...
explanations.C: You can only have one value for the perimeter... To find the perimeter add the lengths of the all the sides together
explanations.D: Remember to find the perimeter add the lengths of the all the sides together!

explanations.A: I think you have forgotten there are 4 sides of the rectangle, not just two...
explanations.B: I think you have missed off one side of the rectangle... 10 + 14 + 10 + 14 = ?
explanations.C: To find the perimeter add the lengths of the all the sides together... 10 + 14 + 10 + 14 = ?
explanations.D: To find the perimeter we add the lengths of the all the sides together: 10 + 14 + 10 + 14 = 48 therefore the perimeter is 48 ft.

explanations.A: This is half of the perimeter of the park, remember a rectangle has 4 sides, not two...
explanations.B: This is the perimeter of Central Park but she runs around it 3 times so you need to multiply this value by 3...
explanations.C: If Central Park is 0.5 miles by 2.5 miles, we do 0.5 + 2.5 + 0.5 + 2.5 = 6 miles to find the perimeter. Jennifer runs around it 3 times 6 x 3 = 18 therefore she ran 18 miles in total.
explanations.D: I think you have confused area and perimeter... To find the perimeter we add the lengths of the all the sides together

explanations.A: I think you have confused area and perimeter... To find the perimeter we add the lengths of the all the sides together
explanations.B: This is half of the perimeter of the mall, remember a rectangle has 4 sides, not two...
explanations.C: This is the perimeter of Rosedale Mall but she walks around it 4 times so you need to multiply this value by 4...
explanations.D: If Rosedale Mall is 1.25 miles by 0.75 miles, we do 1.25 + 0.75 + 1..25 + 0.75 = 4 miles to find the perimeter. Sandra walks around it 4 times 4 x 4 = 16 therefore she walked 16 miles in total.

explanations.A: I think you have confused area and perimeter... The perimeter is all the sides added together
explanations.B: This is the total minus one width but we need to subtract two widths from the total and then halve this value to find the length...
explanations.C: This represents two lengths of the room...
explanations.D: The total length of lights is 15.4m. The width of Fatima's room is 3.5m so we can do 3.5 + 3.5 = 7m and take this off the total to find the total of the other two sides. 15.4 - 7 = 8.4 therefore the length of the room is 8.4 รท 2 = 4.2m.

explanations.A: This represents two lengths of the room...
explanations.B: I think you have confused area and perimeter... The perimeter is all the sides added together
explanations.C: The total length of lights is 21.2m. The width of Catherine's room is 4.8m so we can do 4.8+ 4.8 = 9.6m and take this off the total to find the total of the other two sides. 21.2 - 9.6 = 11.6 therefore the length of the room is 11.6 รท 2 = 5.8m.
explanations.D: This is the total minus one width but we need to subtract two widths from the total and then halve this value to find the length...
